ProjectTitle: Organdroids: Remotely controlled organoid-based biohybrid robots
InitialFeedbackHistory:
20/01/2025
Data: please use the data table from the template as you did for the data from WP2 and 3 in the 2nd table; it is not clear why you use 2 tables since these Work Packages are also listed in the first table, probably best to combine? Please also include the samples that you may use, these are regarded as physical data within the context of a DMP. Additionally, in the subsequent questions, please describe how you will document, store, preserve, and share these materials. 
Ethics: you answer dual use here; dual use data is data with potential for military applications, is that the case for you project? If so please have a look at the flowchart on the website for he EC DMM: https://set.kuleuven.be/ethicsatarenberg/expertise-center-ethics-arenberg-1/copy_of_dual-use/dual-use and apply for approval if needed. If you work with animals, human participants, personal data and/or human bodily material including cells, please answer that you work with both human and animal data and include the relevant approval numbers, for more information see https://research.kuleuven.be/en/integrity-ethics/ethics/committees/index. Please submit an updated DMP as intermediate DMP when you have the necessary ethical approvals, for clinical studies the approval number should start with an S
Preservation: what is included in the hard copy data? Please note that original signed informed consents have to be kept even when you made a digital copy.
Sharing: will you share data with other researchers via a trusted data repository? For more information see: https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/guidance/data-sharing
label: good with suggestions
